greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into parts 7k+2 and 7k+6 with at least one part of each type.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000 (first 125 terms from Robert Price)
maple: b:= proc(n, i, t, s) option remember; `if`(n=0, t*s, `if`(i<1, 0,
b(n, i-1, t, s)+(h-> `if`(h in {2, 6}, add(b(n-i*j, i-1,
mathematica: nmax = 71; s1 = Range[0, nmax/7]*7 + 2; s2 = Range[0, nmax/7]*7 + 6;
x_ /; ContainsAny[x, s1 ] && ContainsAny[x, s2 ]], {n, 1, nmax}] (* _Robert Price_, Aug 14 2020 *)
nmax = 71; l = Rest@CoefficientList[Series[(-1 + 1/Product[(1 - x^(7 k + 2)), {k, 0, nmax}])*(-1 + 1/Product[(1 - x^(7 k + 6)), {k, 0, nmax}]), {x, 0, nmax}], x]  (* _Robert Price_, Aug 16 2020 *)
results.author: _Olivier Gérard_
